title: Hello there, is the pckf still up and active?
content:
that's a rhetorical question, I know it is.
But does the rest of the world know that'? I'm not so sure about; enter 'Commander Keen forum' in your google search engine, it gives me [url=http://www.google.nl/search?q=commander+keen+forum&hl=nl&lr=&start=0&sa=N]this[/url] result. No pckf to be found.
That's something to worry about, if google can't find it how are new members supposed to do?

Maybe there is something we can do about that-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: Hello there, is the pckf still up and active?
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] You're right.. That's bad. Hmmm. I guess we could do a Google bomb. However, it'd require a lot work and many participants. But it could be done. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Hello there, is the pckf still up and active?
content:
Hmm, yeah, I find links to things like wikipedia articles about the PCKF, but no PCKF!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] -Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Hello there, is the pckf still up and active?
content:
I am sure that if we change the text at the top of the page from:
[quote]Quote:[hr]This Commander Keen message board belongs to Cerebral Cortex 314, the #1 Commander Keen site.[hr][/quote]

To:

[quote]Quote:[hr]This Commander Keen forum belongs to Cerebral Cortex 314, the #1 Commander Keen site.[hr][/quote]

You would get the PCKF on that search just because it would match the string. It would take a little while to show up. Google would need to crawl back around the internet and scan this page again.

And I remember how I found the PCKF...

Actually... no... I don't remember how I found it... but I DO remember that I found it by a roundabout way. I found Glen Rhoads Commander Keen flash game and I started searching around for Commander Keen stuff. Then I stumbled on this but that was only after I found many dead "Ultimate Fan Pages" that haven't been updated since 97'. I was *CONVINCED* that Commander Keen was dead and that I was the only fan left alive. (Ok so not that drastic but still.)

Djaser is right. Unless someone does some hardcore digging on Commander Keen all they see is a dead fan base. I know. I thought that for years.-----------------------
[url=http://Galaxie.Spatang.com][img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/New-blegd-smeeg-banner-60.png[/img][/url]
